You a virgin? -- Ya let 'im in ya pants, didn't ya!  Ya pulled down ya pants an' let him have it, didn't ya!! Mortified, Adrian runs to her room... Rocky steps to Paul
(fuming)
Hey -- Paulie cocks the bat back and tenses... Rocky remains sti
(softly)
... I can't haul meat no more.
What can I do about it?
Christ, I been beggin' ya for a break until I'm sick inside.

What break?  Huh?  What break! Who am I to give breaks!  I'm a fighter, you haul meat.  You do what you do an' I do what I do best -- that's it -- that's life, man! Paulie looks ashamed... Rocky walks, then returns.
(continuing)

... An' what ya said to my girlfriend ain't right -- Do it again, I'll kill ya. Rocky goes into the bedroom... Adrian has buried her face a pillow... She is rocking slightly.  Rocky cradles her a kisses her cheek.
(continuing)
Wanna hear a dirty joke?
(smiles)

Mickey is in his cluttered office above the gym... the ro is dark.  Blankets are tacked over the windows.  Rocky is watching 8 mm movies of Apollo Creed in action... Rocky watches with intense concentration as the fighter moves l a huge dancer around the ring.
His defense is great, can't lie 'bout that -- You have a rollin' style.  Can't retreat as fast -- But your style ain't retreatin'. They both watch the flickering images.
(continuing)
See how he plays sometimes -- Drives his cornermen nuts. Nobody knows his next move -- Him included. They watch more action... Creed has a fighter helpless against the ropes.
(continuing)
Killer instinct -- Ya both got the killer touch.  Interestin'. See that! -- Right-cross combination.  Beautiful.  But you got the power to rip the body. They watch more action.
(continuing)

Rocky, when ya climb into the square, an' know ya' meetin' the best fighter in the world, ya' gonna be ready, ya' gonna be ready 'cause I been waitin' for fifty years -- Fifty years. When I'm done with you, you'll gonna be able to spit nails.

You'll gonna be able to eat lightin' and crap thunder -- You'll be a very, very dangerous person... The SCENE FADES on Mickey's voice and Rocky staring transfixed at the images projecting on the wall...
Rocky is pounding the heavy bag with intense concentratio As he strikes from all angles, Mickey instructs.
Rocky now works on the incline situp board... While doing situps, he pounds himself in the stomach with a dumbbell. The pain is evident on his face.
Pushups between two chairs as Mike sits on his shoulders. Mickey coaching drives him on.
Mike has on a pair of target gloves and Rocky moves aroun the ring swinging at them.
Drenched in sweat, Rocky hums the speed bag.  His express is hard and flushed.  Mickey clicks a stopwatch and pats Rocky's shoulder... He is very happy.
Rocky has just completed exercising with the medicine bal Dino hands him a towel... Paulie crosses the gym as Rocky heads to the steam room... A thin man crosses the gym and Mickey nods.
What cha say, Benny -- Meet 'The Rock.' This is our cutman, Benny Stein.
Yo, Benny.
Check the eyes, Ben.
Benny checks the skin around Rocky's eyes.
Ain't bad.  Seen worse -- Cover up an' things should be okay.
Take a shower. Heading towards the shower, Rocky is intercepted by Pauli who traverses the gym.  He stops Rocky at the shower room entrance.

Yo, Rock, I think I found an angle to make some bread usin' ya name, ya mind? Exhausted, Rocky studies Paulie's face a moment and nods 'yes.'... Rocky sways into the shower room and Paulie strides off.
Running... Rocky's crowd of trailing boys has tripled. Dashing through the streets, he resembles the Pied Piper.

It is twilight and Rocky is alone at the very bottom of a huge flight of steps that seem to stretch into the heaven Rocky takes a deep breath and sprints up the never-ending stairs... Halfway up, his body shows the strain.  Nearing the top, Rocky pumps with all his strength and arrives at the very top... He looks down the steep stairs and swells with pride... He is ready.
Rocky is led into Mayor Rizzo's office by an aide... Rock is very nervous as he approaches the mayor, who is seated behind his wide desk.
Sit down, Rocky. Flips open a thick file that lays in front of him.
(continuing)
I've been going over your record -- You've been the busy type -- (reading)
Nineteen arrests -- probation three times -- expelled from seven public schools in 1964 and '65. Rocky tries to sink into the chair.
(continuing)

I'm a very busy man, but I just wanted to remind you that you'll be setting an example for thousands of guys like yourself and maybe start them off in a new direction and give our police force a break -- I also hope you try your very best and bring pride to Philadelphia.
... I'll try. The mayor presses a button and a photographer enters.
Would you stand up, please. Rocky rises and the mayor shakes his hand... Their pictur is taken three times... The photographer exits.
(continuing)
Thank you for coming by, Rocky -- good luck.
(turns)
Any time.
(sitting)
Wait... After the fight you'll have nearly a hundred and fifty thousand dollars -- What do you plan to do with it?
(smiles)
... Run for mayor. The mayor is shocked at first but then breaks into a big, friendly laugh, and Rocky exits.
Adrian and Rocky are at his apartment.  They are looking new scrapbooks.  Newsweek Magazine: Headline: "The Italia Stallion or Donkey?" -- Philadelphia Magazine -- Rocky stands with the mayor.
Rocky, do you realize everybody in this country knows your face, and after the fight everybody in the world is going to.

Yeah... She flips through Sports Illustrated, The American Sports Ring Magazine, World Boxing, True, and a multitude of oth clippings. The TELEPHONE RINGS... Rocky rises and walks to the new white object hanging on the wall.
(continuing)

My first call... Hello?  Yeah, speakin' -- Who is this? Bruce?  Bruce who? -- Yo, Bruce!  How ya been?  I ain't seen ya for nine or eight years -- Yeah, things is great, how's things with you upstate -- Ya sellin' real estate, hey, that's a good job... Yeah, I gotta advance, but I bought ringside seats for the guys at the gym.  I get the hundred an' fifty grand after the fight... Adrian overhears the statement.
(continuing)

... Yeah, I know it's a lotta money -- Condominiums?  Nobody uses them anybody.  Listen, I think a pet shop is a good investment, y'know -- I don't care 'bout long hours -- there's no depreciation -- that don't matter none to me -- Yeah, I like animals. Why don't ya give me ya number an' I'll call ya back?  Lemme getta pencil -- Rocky makes no motion to get a pencil.
(continuing)
Okay, what is it -- four- twelve 659-2424.  Yeah, yeah, thanks for callin' -- Sure I'll get back to ya, Bruce -- see ya. Rocky hangs up.
What was that you said about a pet shop?
(distant)
... What?
What did you say about a pet shop?
I don't want ya cleanin' nobody else's cages no more.
Is everything all right?
I gotta go out for a while. Rocky grabs his coat and moves to the front door.
(continuing; to dog)
... Come.

Rocky arrives at Goldmill's Gym... He unlocks the gym's d Rocky and the dog move through the eerie shadows of the g Rocky moves across the gym with his dog and moves up the steps to Mickey's office... At the top of the stairs he looks down at the ring, reflects for a moment, then enter the office.
After turning on the lights, he quickly cleans the clutte desk and sets up the projector... He goes to the cabinet removes a stack of 16 mm films.

The office clock indicates it is several hours later.  Ro is engrossed in watching another Apollo Creed film.  He s motionless. Rocky sits upright.  Something catches his eyes... He springs at the projector.  He reruns the scene several ti

Several hours later Rocky is engrossed in watching anothe Apollo Creed film... He sits motionless.  Something catch his eye.  Rocky stops the projector as Apollo is deliveri a knockout blow to an unfortunate opponent. Rocky moves right up to freeze frame and inspects it like was a priceless painting... He backs off and begins writi on a note pad.

The first light of dawn streams through Mickey's filthy windows... Rocky is slumped in a chair and it is apparent has lost interest in watching the movies. The film has completed its run through the projector and lazily flops around on the top reel... Listlessly Rocky r his reddened eyes.
The door opens and Mickey flips on the light... The two m stare at each other for a long moment.  Mickey studies Rocky's despondent expression and knows what is on the fighter's mind.

... I know what you're thinkin'm kid -- At least ya gotta shot -- All ya can do is try ya' best. Rocky stands and, with his dog, inches past Mickey and ex the room.  Mickey walks over and turns off the projector. He idly pushes the machine with a lazy motion until it slides off the desk and crashes to the floor.
After leaving Mickey's gym, Rocky and his dog listlessly move down the street and head for home.
Rocky arrives at his apartment... Adrian is asleep on the couch.  He lowers himself beside her.  Her eyes open.
... Can't do it.
... What?
... I can't beat him.
Apollo?
Yeah, I can't beat him. Adrian touches his face.
I been watchin' the movies -- studyin' -- He ain't weak nowhere.
What're we going to do?
... I dunno.
Oh, Rocky -- you worked so hard.
It ain't so bad, 'cause I was a nothin' before --
Don't say that.

C'mon, it's true -- But that don't bother me -- I just wanna prove somethin' -- I ain't no bum... It don't matter if I lose... Don't matter if he opens my head... The only thing I wanna do is go the distance -- That's all. Nobody's ever gone fifteen rounds with Creed.  If I go them fifteen rounds, an' that bell rings an' I'm still standin', I'm gonna know then I weren't just another bum from the neighborhood... Adrian touches Rocky's face... The fighter gently lowers himself beside his woman.
(continuing)
... No foolin' around.

It is the night of the Bicentennial fight... The location the Philadelphia Spectrum. The Spectrum is filling to capacity... Grandly dressed celebrities and wealthy fight fans lower themselves into their ringside seat.  Nearly everyone is holding a red, white, and blue sweater... The arena is decorated in tons of patriotic red, white an blue.  High above the ring are huge posters of GEORGE
FRANKLIN - and APOLLO CREED.
Apollo Creed sits in his dressing room... It is dead sile except for some NOISE that filters under the door from th arena.
It is a CLOSE-UP of Apollo's hand being taped... The RASP SOUND of the adhesive tape is very pronounced.
The atmosphere is identical to Apollo's dressing room. Adrian watches in silence as Mike wraps Rocky's hand. Again, the most pronounced SOUND is the RASPING of the adhesive tape.
Apollo's other hand is being wrapped.  Dead silence excep for the TAPE and APOLLO'S BREATHING.
Rocky's other hand is being wrapped in a CLOSE-UP.  The o SOUND is the TAPE and ROCKY'S mounting BREATHING PATTERN.
CLOSE-UP of drops being placed in his nose to help increa his intake of oxygen.  The tremendously magnified SOUND o APOLLO TAKING IN AIR.
CLOSE-UP of the drops being placed in Rocky's nose.
A heavy coating of vaseline is applied around the Champio eyes... In an EXTREME CLOSE-UP, the eyes shine brightly w the grease.
Grease is smeared around Rocky's eyes... In the EXTREME CLOSE-UP several deep scars are SEEN.
CLOSE-UP of Apollo's trainer digging his fingers deeply i the thick neck muscles of Apollo's upper back and neck.
CLOSE-UP OF Mike's arms wrapped around Rocky's waist and lifting his diaphragm up... Magnified BREATHING ROARS fro the screen.
Apollo's trainer slips a mouthpiece into Apollo's mouth. Apollo shakes his head and the trainer removes it and pla another one in the champ's mouth... Creed nods yes.

Everyone present is motionless as Rocky is in the bathroo Alone, Rocky is on his knee praying.  Completing his sile prayer, he stands and looks at himself in the mirror. Suddenly a wave of emotion sweeps over him as he thinks t in a few moments he will face the most overwhelming chall of his life. Out in the dressing room, the door opens and a guard lean in and nods that it is time.  He leaves... Rocky steps ou
... It's time, kid. Rocky nods and moves toward Adrian.
... I'll wait for you here. Rocky nods and she kisses him.  The fighter leaves with h trainers... Adrian is on the verge of tears.
Rocky, Mickey and Mike start down the long hallway... Up ahead are three security guards... Rocky rubs his bare shoulders.
Yo, Mick, can I have my rob? Rocky puts on the robe... Embroidered across the back in flaming letters is:
*Pennzoil*
Mike helps him into the robe... Mickey is not amused.
Don't you care what the people will say?
... I'm doin' it for a friend.
Whatta you get outta this?
I get the robe an' Paulie gets three grand.
... Shrewd.
TWO RINGSIDE COMMENTATORS sit in front of a panel of clos circuit televisions.

We would like to welcome our viewing audience to the Grand World Championship Bicentennial Heavyweight Fight -- the first major event of the Bicentennial Year... A point of interest is that the fight is being beamed to more than seven hundred and fifty million fans in theatres in nearly every corner of the world.  I would like to welcome an old friend, and co- commentator for this evening's event -- Jimmy Michaels.

Thank you, Bob.  The electricity is everywhere tonight.  Rocky Balboa, a fifty-to-one underdog, is living a Cinderella story which has captured peoples' imaginations all over the world -- to quote a popular sports magazine, 'The fighting style should be 'The Caveman Against the Cavalier.' From the increase in sound it appears the challenger is now approaching the ring... His record is forty-four wins, twenty losses and thirty-eight knockouts.
I only wonder if this man has the skill to go past three rounds -- Vegas odds say, 'no.'

A wedge of uniformed guards knife down the aisle to the r Many people wish Rocky well as he passes... people also h insults.  From the expression on Mickey's face it is also the greatest night of his life.  In the audience are fami faces from the gym.  From the back of the arena a ROAR go up... Apollo Creed is in a mock boat dressed like George Washington.  He throws silver dollars.  The NOISE builds DEAFENING proportions.  Creed's trainer holds the rope an Creed bounds into the ring.  He tears off the Washington outfit and it is clearly SEEN that Apollo Creed is garbed an outrageous Uncle Sam outfit... On his head is a red, white and blue sequined top hat.  The robe is sequined re white and blue.  His boxing trunks are red, white and blu silk with stars around the waistband.  The boxing shoes match the trunks.  On his chin is a pointed white Uncle S beard.
You could go deaf with the noise -- it undoubtedly means Champion Apollo Creed is heading towards the ring --
Am I seeing right?  Creed is approaching the ring in a boat. Is he supposed to be George Washington?  Obviously so.
It's been confirmed that it is definitely an impersonation of George Washington -- a great way to start 1976 off.
I agree. Immediately Creed begins gracefully dancing in a wide cir He passes within inches of Rocky in his Uncle Sam outfit.
I want you!  I want you! The crowd loves the taunting.  Apollo Creed floats back t his corner.
Don't let 'im get you tight.
Whatta ya think that outfit cost?

The ANNOUNCER steps to the center of the ring... Several in suits stand against the ropes... Paulie is dressed nic and sits at ringside with a pretty blonde escort.  Rocky waves at him.  Paulie waves back and secretly gestures at his date... Rocky smiles and gestures back.

Ladies and gentlemen -- Welcome to the Bicentennial Heavyweight Championship Fight... We are very proud to have with us four former Great Champions... Ladies an' gents, 'The one and only 'Manassa Mauler' -- Jack Dempsey!' The CROWD ROARS and JACK DEMPSEY waves and goes to Creed' corner, then Rocky's.
Good luck, kid. He moves off.
(to Mickey)
Christ, Jack Dempsey.
The Announcer points and the timekeeper RINGS the BELL.
Former Middleweight Champion -- 'The Bronx Bull' -- Jake LaMotta! JAKE LA MOTTA raises his fist and gives best wishes to bo contenders... Timekeeper RINGS the BELL.
(continuing)
The man with the big punch -- Everybody's favorite, 'The Brown Bomber ' -- Joe Louis!
JOE LOUIS bows and steps to Creed's corner.  Creed strike boxing pose and Louis tosses a playful punch.
They must be friends.

Now, last but certainly not least -- the former Heavyweight Champion, a son of Philly, Smoking Joe Frazier! FRAZIER rumbles to the center of the ring.  The CROWD CHE Apollo puts on a show... He grimaces and gestures like he going to attack Frazier.  His cornermen hold him back.  T laugh.  Frazier goes to Rocky's corner.
Save some of him for me.
The Commentators beckon to Frazier as he exits the ring.
The former champ looks great -- Can we get Joe over here -- here he comes. Joe Frazier stands in front of the Commentators.
(continuing)
Joe, what are your feelings about tonight's fight?
Well, I think any man who works an' trains hard always gotta chance.
You look in great shape, Joe.
I'm always in shape. Joe laughs and exits.  The timekeeper RINGS the BELL.

... Now for the evening's main event -- In the corner to my right, The Challenger, wearing white trunks -- At one hundred an' ninety-one pounds, one of Philly's own sons -- 'The Italian Stallion,' Rocky Balboa! A good CROWD RESPONSE.

In the far corner, wearing red, white an' blue -- Weighing in at two hundred and ten pounds -- Undefeated in forty- six fights -- the Heavyweight Champion of the World -- 'The Master of Disaster' -- Apollo Creed! The arena EXPLODES and Creed puts on a display of hand sp

The REFEREE motions to both fighters... They step to the center of the ring.  As the Referee explains the rules Apollo and Rocky stare hard into each other's eyes... The Referee's voice fades and the fighters' expressions fill screen... Something soulful and frightening is being communicated.
... Now come out fighting. The fighters return to their corners.
God bless ya, Rock.
Thanks, Mick -- I'm gonna try.
The BELL RINGS... Creed dances forward and boxes Rocky as though he considers the man an amateur.

The Champ stings the slower challenger with jabs at will -- Balboa blocks eighty percent of the blows with his face -- Creed doesn't look the best he's ever been but is moving smoothly -- Creed snaps out a triple combination that backs Balboa into a corner -- oh, a solid hook by Creed, a master of fist-men.

The Champion is smiling and toying with the man -- trying to give the fans their money's worth and make a show of it with the badly out-classes challenger -- Another left to right combination.  I feel sorry for --
Creed is down!!!
Rocky suddenly explodes with an upswing hook to the jaw. Creed is dropped.  The arena EXPLODES.  Creed's eyes show disbelief.  So do Rocky's. Rocky backs into his corner... Mickey and Mike yell at hi
You can do it!  Goddamnit, you got the power!  The body, get the body!!!  Ya got him goin'!
Six!... Seven!... Eight!... Creed is up... His playful attitude is gone... he is now business.  His lightning jab stings Rocky's face repeated
... Come at me, sucker! Rocky charges and a terrific right crashes against Apollo chin, followed by an uppercut to the liver that causes Cr to cringe...
Apollo counters with jabs and Rocky whips brutal combinat to the body. The BELL RINGS.
How am I doin'?
Real good.
See how fast he is -- damn!
Breathe deep -- Keep ya chin down!!  Use the legs and drive through 'im.  Attack -- Attack -- Attack!
Apollo does not sit.  He stands and clowns with the spectators to prove he is not hurt.
(to Trainer)
... That boy damn near broke my arm.
Sure -- He can hit -- Don't play no more -- Stick an' move, hear?
I'll carry him 'till the third.
Don't play with this man, he's fightin' hard -- Let 'em feel some real heat!

The BELL for the second round RINGS... Rocky rushes out f and furious.  Apollo melts out a left hook that raises a goose egg over Rocky's eye... Apollo employs footwork tha dazzles Rocky.  He has class.  He studies Rocky and emplo his lightning jab with cutting accuracy. Still Rocky shuf ahead, bombarding Creed's midsection with hooks.
The round ends with Apollo assaulting Rocky with blinding combinations and delivering a stupendous right cross that flings Rocky into the ropes and shatters his nose... The round ends.
Apollo stands in his corner and jokes with the fans, but is beginning to show the strain from the body punches.
Man, I rearranged his face with that right -- The people love what's happenin' tonight.
People nothin', you in a fight, my man, -- ya best believe what you hear... Knock that boy out soon an' let's go home.
Rocky sits as Mickey and Benny try to reduce the swelling around his eyes... The nose is shattered.
Ya nose is broke.
Damn!  How's it look?
Can't hardly tell.  Don't swallow the blood -- Go for his ribs.  Don't let 'im breathe.
... The guy's great.
Why don't ya tell 'im you're a fan!
The Commentators are caught up in the action.  They speak rapidly into their microphones.

If you had asked anyone who knows boxing, they never would've predicted a first round knockdown and the second round punishment to the body of the Champion... Most fighters will tell you, receiving a good body punch is the next worst thing to dying.
Round three ready to start and should be interesting to see if Creed can put the challenger away -- there goes the bell.

Round three... Apollo comes out dancing.  He skips and si steps Rocky's sledgehammer hooks.  An expert ring general Apollo uses the ring fully.  Rocky keeps tearing in and Creed meets the bombing attack that cause thick swelling. Near the end of the round Rocky fires a penetrating punch the heart.

Apollo almost sprints out of his corner -- feints and throws a pair of left-right combinations.  Balboa drops beneath a left upper cut and lands a very solid shot on Creed's temple -- not much movement from Balboa, duck a left, a right, another left and explodes with a right hook to the temple -- I mean explodes.  The Champ backs off.
There's no way Apollo expected this kind of hitting power.
No way -- but the brilliant ability of the Champion to master situations like this is one of his most outstanding traits -- Creed tosses a perfect right hand that rocks Rocky.

Creed on the offensive -- Balboa takes the punishment and counters with a left flush over the heart... that hurt. The wallop knocks Apollo off balance... The CAMERA GOES T STEEP ANGLE SHOT from the floor, VERTICALLY UP Apollo's b The SCENE GOES INTO SLOW MOTION... Rocky releases a terrifying uppercut that opens a gash under Creed's eye. Creed's face contorts with excruciation.
(yelling)
Cover your face!  Cover up! (to Assistant)
My man's cut, my man's bleedin' -- Get ready!
The BELL SOUNDS.  Apollo's corner works frantically to cl the wound... The ring DOCTOR inspects the cut.
Bad?  Talk to me, man!
Deep, but passable.
(staring at Rocky)
... That man's takin' his job too serious.
He's movin' to your left -- don't let him no more -- dance and stick, hear?  Don't play -- I know what ya feelin', but don't play.
He got lucky.
Luck!  You fightin' a crazy man -- but you got him hurt bad. (to Assistant)
More ice, now!
Rocky's face is in very bad shape, not cut, but wretchedl swollen around the eyes.
How you holdin' up, kid?
Fine... That guy's great.
Gimme the water!  Ya getttin' tagged with his right.  I think you should feint left and high hook 'im -- Benny, check the eyes!  Can ya see?
(standing)
See what?
Ya sappin' his strength -- He's losin' steam.
He ain't losin' nothin'.
Keep on him -- You're doin' great.
In the next ten rounds, Apollo cuts and slashes Rocky to ribbons, but pays dearly... Both his eyes and lips are cu Welts across his midsection attest to Rocky's body-batter
Adrian is unable to remain alone... She is lured by the GROWING ROAR OF THE FANS... She exits the dressing room.

Stepping out of the dressing room she walks down the corr The MOUNTING CHEERS make her speed up.  She opens the doo at the end of the corridor and is hit by a THUNDEROUS WAV OF SOUND.  The guard at the door inspects her and goes ba to watching the fight.

Adrian stands at the rear of the arena and watches the battle.  She is entranced by the power of it all. Back in the ring, Rocky keeps grinding ahead.  He plants thumping left over the Champion's heart and Creed winces. Rocky is game but losing. At ringside Paulie is frantic... He is living the fight f his seat. Mr. Gazzo and his Bodyguard watch from the second row. Gazzo looks proud.  The Bodyguard, impassive.
A huge and lively crowd look up at the television over th bar... They see Rocky driving Creed against the ropes and cheer loudly.
... The Rock's got real stones.
The men are fighting with appalling tenacity.  Rocky rips and tears into the body... Apollo counters with a ceasele stream of rapier-like lefts... The Challenger is seriousl outclassed.

C'mon -- Lemme cut yo'! Rocky wades in and Creed employs incredible footwork.  He sets himself and cuts loose with a thunderbolt right cros to Rocky's already broken nose.  Blood sprays from the wo and red droplets drip from his chin... Rocky takes a merciless beating and is staggered by a torrent of combinations.  Rocky's eyes are closed.  But Creed cannot drop him... The BELL RINGS.
The Commentators shift in their seats.
Without a doubt this is the most punishing brawl I have ever seen -- The ringside audience is spotted with blood.
This fight should have been stopped rounds ago but Rocky Balboa refuses to fall --
Not only has he refused to fall, but he has beaten the Champion's body without mercy and the bout has become a vicious slugfest.
Apollo's corner is in turmoil... The Champion is definite hurt.
My side.
(to Assistant)
Get that doctor.
No doctor!
You're hurtin', man!
No doctor!... I'm feelin' good, bro!
In Rocky's corner, things are frantic.  His eyes are swol shut.
Wanna keep goin'?
Would you keep goin'?
... Yeah.
No more, ya wanna lose an eye? No more.

Open my eyes -- Please, open my eyes! Mickey nods to Benny.  He secretly places a small ring kn between his index and middle finger.  In one smooth movem he drags the razor over the blood welts and quickly cover the draining wounds with gauze... It is done so quickly n one is ever aware of the operation.
At the rear of the arena Adrian looks transfixed at the r She is caught up in the heat of the battle.

The BELL RINGS for round fourteen.  Rocky bores in close, but Apollo still has spring in his legs.  He seems determ to end it this round... Apollo catches Rocky flush on the jaw.  Rocky is staggered.  Like a wolf, Apollo cuts loose with pure savagery.  Rocky is driven against the ropes an receives a devastating beating from the Champion... Rocky dropped. Rocky sits stunned in the middle of the ring... Everythin is a distortion.  He looks for familiar faces as though t ask for help... Mickey and Mike scream frantically for hi to stay down.

Six -- Seven -- Eight -- Rocky gets to his feet and tenses with renewed energy.  H is like a wounded wild animal.  The tide suddenly turns. Rocky drops low and catches Apollo with a pair of terrifi body punches that seem to drive Apollo's diaphragm up to throat... A CRACK is HEARD.  A glaze of pain covers Apoll eyes.  It is only a supreme effort that keeps the Champio upright... Apollo is badly hurt.  He is bent over. Rocky moves towards Apollo.  Apollo flicks dread jabs int Rocky's eyes... The Italian wades in with punches that se to bulge out Apollo's back.  Creed takes the punishment l a stoic. Blood is running from Apollo's mouth.  In the clinch he leans over Rocky and it drips down the Italian's neck and shoulders.  Apollo shields his wound from the ringside judges and continues to fight.
The BELL RINGS.  Apollo's men rush out and guide him to h corner.
... Ribs broke -- Blood trickles from the corner of Apollo's mouth.  The Trainer feels the ribs.
Yo' bleedin' inside, man -- Get that doctor.
One more round.
Don't kill yourself, man -- Let the doctor stop the fight.
... Stop jivin'!
Cover the ribs -- Look here, elbow down, tight -- Tight -- stand straight -- you're the best, you're the best!
... Thanks.
Rocky no longer resembles himself... His face has complet been beaten to jelly, but his mood is buoyant.
How I look out there, Mick?
(truly worried)
Great, kid, great. The ring Doctor leans over Rocky and checks the eyes.
One more round -- How do you feel? Rocky is approaching the supreme moment of his life.  He cannot be bothered with pain or doctors.
Fine -- Go away, I'm gonna make it -- I'm gonna make it! Everyone is distraught over Rocky's dangerous condition.
We gotta stop it, kid.
Ya gave it ya best shot!
Nobody's gonna say ya didn't give ya all.  I can't let ya go out. Rocky stands and eyes them all.
(impassioned and quietly)
I'll kill ya all... Don't stop nothin' --
The BELL RINGS... Apollo moves cautiously out of his corn and circles to Rocky's right.
The Commentators stare unansweringly at the fighters.

The fight has slowed down to a near stand-still -- Creed circles to Rocky's right... The spectrum is nearly silent -- Neither fighter has made a motion to throw... I've never seen anything like it in the last round of a championship fight... Apollo spits blood on the canvas.  It appears he is protecting his right side.  His ribs were probably injured at the end of round fourteen.
It's confirmed, unofficially, Creed's ribs may be broken -- Apollo fakes a left and throws a big tired right -- Balboa's mouthpiece is out!  Creed attacks with one hand!

Apollo feints and Rocky falls for it.  The Champion unlea a lethal blow to the side of the head that jolts Rocky's mouthpiece into the second row... Rocky sags against the ropes in a crucified position... The insane crowd leaps t their feet.

Rocky's bloody teeth snarl at Apollo and he waves him to come ahead and fight toe to toe... Apollo obliges with a weary but effective burst of rights and lefts that have K written on every punch.  Rocky counters the assault blow blow.
Gimme ya best!!!! Mickey looks at the clock... TEN SECONDS TO GO.
(continuing)

Gimme ya best!!! Blood sprays over the ropes and onto the ringside photographers... They are horrified and wipe away the blo The fighters stand toe to toe and drag every remaining bi of strength from their souls and beat each other without mercy.  They look hypnotized and have entered a dimension far beyond blood and pain.
The BELL RINGS... The arena EXPLODES with thunderous appr

Their cornermen rush to their collapsed fighters... In th midst of all the confusion both fighters look at each oth with unabashed respect -- They stand like blood-drenched gladiators on the most dramatic night of their lives. As though reacting to some unspoken command, they both st towards each other and embrace... Apollo whispers in Rock ear.
... Ain't gonna be no rematch.
... Don't want one. Mickey comes over and separates them and leads him back t his corner... Mickey embraces him.
The Announcer enters the ring with a microphone.

Attention, please!!  Attention!! Ladies and gentlemen, tonight we have had the rare privilege to have witnessed the greatest exhibitions of stamina and guts ever in the history of sports. The CROWD ROARS.
(continuing)
Ladies and gentlemen -- We have a split decision!
Apollo did not expect this and tenses.  His corner nervou tries to reassure him.  It does no good.
Rocky did not expect this either and looks in confusion a Mickey, but Mickey is frozen with anticipation.
Judge Walker scores it eight- seven Creed... Judge Roseman scores it eight-seven Balboa.
Apollo is rigid.  Fear radiates from his eyes.  To lose t crown on this night after the fight he fought would kill him... A silence has blanketed the arena.
Judge Conners scores it nine- six Creed... Winner and still Heavyweight Champion of the World, Apollo Creed!
Rocky sorely smiles and looks at the waves of CHEERING fa that circle the ring and reach out towards him... Mickey grabs Rocky's hand and raises it.  The CROWD ROARS.
I don't care what they say, you're a winner.

Yo, can I have my locker back? Mickey and Rocky look at each other and grin.  Mickey hug Rocky like a son.  Mickey raises Rocky's hand again.  Roc turns away from Mickey and pats Benny the cut-man's shoulder... Benny smiles wearily.  Rocky stares across th ring at Apollo Creed, who stands victorious, but his face and body are badly distorted... The two men lock stares t reflect admiration.
Apollo climbs out of the ring and the fans crush forward screaming his name and waving red, white and blue banners
Rocky also climbs out of the ring and waves of frantic we wishing fans rumble forward... Mickey's eyes show mountin apprehension as the fans become abnormally active.

They shove the police aside and clutch wildly at Creed. Creed's army of bodyguards swing angrily at the crowd but they are soon engulfed by screaming waves of humanity. Apollo is suddenly hoisted into the air and is being carr along by a legion of fans.

On the opposite aisle Rocky is experiencing the same overwhelming adulation by his fans but does not seem to b frightened by it, like Apollo.  Mickey tries his best to control things but his voice is drowned out in the growin clamor.  The fans shove the guards aside and hoist Rocky their shoulders.
Rocky's and Apollo's fans are aggressively competing agai each other... chanting, 'Creed, Creed, Creed.' Rocky's fans counter by bellowing, 'Rocky, Rocky, Rocky.'
Paulie tries to get to Rocky but is shoved aside and he starts swinging.
Both Rocky and Apollo are completely at the mercy of the crowd.  They are being passed overhead and remain helples as their bodies float up the aisle on the sea of hands... The CHANTING IS DEAFENING.
Fearful that Rocky is in danger, Adrian tries to move forward.  Running headlong into the crowd, she angles through the mass to get to Rocky.

She is manhandled and shoved in a multitude of directions but she keeps her feet... She sees him.  In the distance, Rocky floats INTO VIEW and Adrian flattens against the wa and waits for the procession to pass. The procession approaches and she clearly sees Rocky's unbelievably battered but smiling face.  He appears to be king of the world. The procession approaches and passes Adrian.  She jumps o her toes and waves frantically but is not seen.  She scre Rocky's name... Somehow the delicate voice knifes through the racket and reaches Rocky. Rocky frantically looks in all directions and barely mana to see Adrian jumping up and down waving.  The crowd is carrying him away.  He attempts to lower himself but the crowd won't permit it.

Rocky instead turns and begins climbing across people's heads and shoulders.  He resembles a man trying to go up down escalator.  People are jammed so tightly together Ro manages to crawl across them to Adrian. Still suspended in air, Rocky leans down and Adrian jumps and they lock in an embrace.
I love you -- I love you -- I love you... The two are swept along into the greatest night anyone ca remember...
